17:30.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Amateur Jockeys' Handicap

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival over 5f in sole start this winter; all wins at 6f
runners.name: Big Bard
runners.spotlight: Failed to beat a rival over 5f in sole start this winter; has done all his winning over 6f, including at Kempton last January; return to this distance is a plus.

runners.comment: Generally consistent; won his last Kempton attempt (in late 2024); solid
runners.name: Portoro
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent, including over 6f (raced mainly at further); has made the frame at Southwell in three starts since returned to AW; won his last Kempton attempt (in late 2024); solid.

runners.comment: Record of 1-6 on AW, the success in December in sole C&D attempt
runners.name: Up The Anti
runners.spotlight: Record of 1-6 on AW, the success when collaring Pinjarra close home in December (off just 1lb lower) in sole C&D attempt; inconsistent results since but the return to this scenario may have positive effect.

runners.comment: Unplaced favourite last time; likely player on some of his earlier form
runners.name: Pinjarra
runners.spotlight: Ran below market expectations last time; likely player on some of his earlier form, notably wins elsewhere in August/October and a close second (nabbed late by Up The Anti) over C&D.

runners.comment: Has remained in form since C&D success in October; respected
runners.name: Southbank
runners.spotlight: Record of 5-27 on AW, the most recent win over C&D in October; has remained in form since, creditable second at Lingfield (6f) last time; respected off unaltered mark.

runners.comment: Has finished last in most starts for current stable
runners.name: Griselda
runners.spotlight: Far from consistent since her turf hat-trick in 2024 and has finished last in most starts for current stable; best watched unless the market suggests a revival is likely.

runners.comment: Multiple AW scorer but has a big doubt over current form
runners.name: Man On A Mission
runners.spotlight: Seven-time AW winner from 2022 to 2024; big doubt over current form, having achieved little in two outings this winter.

runners.comment: Capable of being involved but isn't particularly solid on recent form
runners.name: Rumba Bay
runners.spotlight: Dual AW winner who has slipped to an attractive mark; well capable of being involved but isn't particularly solid on her form since returned to this sphere.

runners.comment: Record suggests this return from a break may be the time to catch her
runners.name: Dark Sorceress
runners.spotlight: Gained sole win off 2lb higher at Chelmsford (6f) on reappearance last year; inconsistent since but this return from a break may be the time to catch her.

runners.comment: Far from solid on his two efforts for new stable
runners.name: The Cola Brasil
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is still seeking first success in Britain and looks far from solid on his two efforts for new stable.

runners.comment: Beat Wind Summer a neck (1m, Polytrack) in December; good h'cap debut latest; big player
runners.name: Roserunner
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the second attempt when beating Wind Summer by a neck in five-runner Lingfield novice (1m, Polytrack) in December; narrow miss on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton (8.5f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; 1lb nudge no problem and he must go well again.

runners.comment: Just denied by Roserunner (1m, Polytrack) in December; firm shout on this handicap debut
runners.name: Wind Summer
runners.spotlight: 28-1 but just denied by Roserunner in five-runner Lingfield novice (1m, Polytrack) in December; another decent effort when third at that track in similar 7f event (first-time cheekpieces, now discarded) last time; good shout on this handicap debut.

runners.comment: Unlucky when runner-up in his second h'cap; off 95 days but feared if ready; gelded
runners.name: Ebn Sabt
runners.spotlight: Stepped up on his handicap debut fourth (1m) in October when just failing over 7f at Wolverhampton (also Tapeta) a fortnight later; subsequently gelded and not seen since but looked unlucky last time; market might help ahead of this Polytrack debut.

runners.comment: Best run over C&D in September; wasn't built on next time and off since; market a help
runners.name: Hamaleel
runners.spotlight: Best run came when second over C&D in September but she didn't build on it when beaten 10l at Wolverhampton (8.5f, Tapeta; first-time cheekpieces) the following month; off subsequently but may do better back here and the betting can prove informative.

runners.comment: Opened account with DH on h'cap debut (1m, Polytrack) earlier this month; open to progress
runners.name: Aneirins Sword
runners.spotlight: Proved easy in the market but opened his account when sharing the spoils on his handicap debut at Chelmsford (1m, Polytrack) at the start of the month; open to progress.

runners.comment: Already on third trainer and makes handicap/AW debut after 177 days away; watch the market
runners.name: Quick Turn
runners.spotlight: All three starts at 6f on turf on a sound surface; hints of ability in two goes for Peter Chapple-Hyam in the summer but left Stuart Williams after one poor run in August; already on his third trainer and now makes his handicap and AW debut after 177 days away; gelded in interim; needs market interest to boost his claims.

runners.comment: Gelded before flopping on h'cap debut (9.5f, Tapeta) last month; visor given a whirl
runners.name: Fans Favourite
runners.spotlight: Gelded before flopping in first-time cheekpieces on his handicap debut at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta) last month; visor given a whirl this time but he's not easy to suggest after that.

runners.comment: Respectable effort when keeping-on fifth here (6f) latest; dam won both her races at 1m
runners.name: Musical Soldier
runners.spotlight: 28-1 and apprentice-ridden but it was a respectable effort when keeping-on fifth of 11 on his handicap debut here (6f) three weeks ago; dam won both her races at 1m so this trip's worth a go; tongue-tie on.

runners.comment: Showed he's in good form with half-length win at Lingfield last week; incurs 5lb penalty
runners.name: Rising Force
runners.spotlight: Has to overcome 5lb penalty and career-high mark but still needs respect, having shown he's in good form with half-length success in amateur riders' event at Lingfield last week on fourth start for new yard.

runners.comment: Seemed to need the run when an 80-1 shot for C&D contest on reappearance
runners.name: Berning Hot
runners.spotlight: Record is 1-13, the win on turf last summer; seemed to need the run when an 80-1 shot for C&D contest on reappearance but the market may again prove best guide to expectations.

runners.comment: Close third over C&D last week and remains well handicapped on peak form; in the mix
runners.name: Mbappe
runners.spotlight: Commenced his 2026 campaign with an encouraging effort (close third) over C&D last week and remains well handicapped on peak form, which includes two wins off higher marks in 2024; enters calculations.

runners.comment: Below best in C&D event on reappearance but may fare better this time
runners.name: Grand Citadel
runners.spotlight: Turf winner; below best over C&D this month on AW debut, return from a break and first start since rejoining Micky Fenton; however, may fare better with that outing under her belt.

runners.comment: Inconsistent maiden who still has something to prove on AW
runners.name: Lady Kameko
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent maiden who possibly needs soft/heavy ground; has achieved little in two starts since returned to AW; enough to prove.

runners.comment: Has struggled in two starts since winning over C&D in December
runners.name: Adace
runners.spotlight: Three course wins, the most recent in December; however, this 8yo mare has struggled in two starts since, latest in the C&D event won by Pave The Way.

runners.comment: Took well to first-time blinkers in C&D contest two weeks ago; respected up just 2lb
runners.name: Pave The Way
runners.spotlight: Prevailed narrowly to open her account in C&D contest two weeks ago on third start for new yard, taking well to first-time blinkers; may have more to offer in the retained headgear; respected up just 2lb.

runners.comment: Drops back from 1m4f to 1m; has shown best form over 1m2f (on turf)
runners.name: Guinness Lad
runners.spotlight: Maiden who regularly fluffs the start; failed to get home over 1m4f last time but whether he needs a drop back to 1m is debatable; best form when runner-up twice over 1m2f (on turf).

runners.comment: In frame plenty of times last year but he's on a long losing spell; fair effort yesterday
runners.name: Eye Of The Water
runners.spotlight: Veteran who is still capable of picking up prize-money, having made the frame plenty of times last year; however, his losing sequence continues to grow; fair effort at Wolverhampton yesterday.

runners.comment: Far from certain to reverse C&D placings with Pave The Way
runners.name: Marchetti
runners.spotlight: Ties in with Pave The Way on C&D running last time but is far from certain to reverse the placings, being a 9yo whose losing run is mounting up, whereas that rival is unexposed in blinkers.

19:00.race_name: Unibet Supports Safer Gambling Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Bumper winner; has finished last in two Kempton events under this code
runners.name: Lion City
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; has finished last, achieving very little, in a couple of middle-distance events (Listed/novice) at Kempton since switched to this code; drops in trip.

runners.comment: Flat-bred 5yo who has gone close to justifying favouritism in three bumpers
runners.name: Naval Tribute
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 5yo who has gone close to justifying favouritism in three bumpers, most recently last March; in the mix, provided the consistency is sustained on debut under this code.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Shaped with some promise in one Irish start and one French outing
runners.name: Shafdar
runners.spotlight: Shaped with some promise in one Irish start and one French outing; sold for 36,000euros since the latter and switches to British racing; market may offer further guidance.

runners.comment: 55,000euros yearling; by Bated Breath; belated debut
runners.name: The Ubermensch
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns foal, 55,000euros yearling; Bated Breath half-brother to German 1m2f/1m3f winner Tansania, out of German Listed-placed 1m3f scorer (RPR 98); belated debut.

runners.comment: Absent since soundly beaten at Kempton in August 2024
runners.name: Wheres The Picnic
runners.spotlight: Absent since soundly beaten, albeit hindered by wide trip, in 7f maiden at Kempton in August 2024; best watched unless the market speaks favourably.

runners.comment: Posted modest RPRs in two turf runs last year; gelded since
runners.name: Al Azd
runners.spotlight: The type to possess potential, being a son of Dubawi and from a major yard, but may be more interesting in handicaps having posted modest RPRs in two turf runs last year; gelded since.

runners.comment: Solid third at Wolverhampton last time; brings the best Flat form
runners.name: Empirical
runners.spotlight: Ran below market expectations on debut but finished a solid third, despite being much weaker in the betting, at Wolverhampton (8.5f; behind subsequent winners) later in December; brings the best Flat form.

runners.comment: 380,000gns yearling; by Farhh; one of the likelier types among the newcomers
runners.name: Exmoor
runners.spotlight: 380,000gns yearling; by Farhh and first foal of 1m/9.4f AW winner (RPR 63), from family of US 1m/1m1f Grade 2 winner Uncharted Haven; one of the likelier types among the newcomers; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Down the field in 7f contest at Kempton
runners.name: Oro Palacio
runners.spotlight: Down the field in 7f contest at Kempton, albeit likely needed the run; may do better but others are preferred.

runners.comment: 750,000gns yearling; powerful stable has an excellent record in this contest; respected
runners.name: Palladas
runners.spotlight: 750,000gns yearling; Lope De Vega half-brother to winners Maltese Falcon (US 8.5f/1m2f including turf Grade 3; RPR 106) and Grey Charger (1m/1m2f including AW; 97); dam 1m scorer (Listed placed 1m5f AW; 96); powerful stable has an excellent record, predominantly with newcomers, in this contest; respected debutant.

runners.comment: 100,000gns yearling; Pinatubo half-brother to two winners; check the betting
runners.name: Stay Salty
runners.spotlight: 100,000gns yearling; Pinatubo half-brother to two winners, notably Battle Of Toro (1m/1m2f Flat, RPR 100; 2m1f hurdle); dam 6f-1m scorer (including AW; 106); check the betting.

runners.breeder: Cornthrop Bloodstock Widden Stud Uk Pty
runners.comment: Modest fourth at Chelmsford last time
runners.name: Tonyfromhr
runners.spotlight: Only a modest fourth at Chelmsford (1m) last time and needs to take another step forward; handicaps are likely to be more suitable shortly.

runners.comment: 24,000gns 2yo; wears hood; other newcomers have stronger claims
runners.name: Warm Waters
runners.spotlight: 24,000gns 2yo; by Too Darn Hot; sibling to six winners, notably Saint Lawrence (6f/7f including Listed/Wokingham Handicap; RPR 112); wears hood; other newcomers have stronger claims.

19:30.race_name: Every Race Live On Racing TV Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B, C and D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 3,000gns foal; this 4yo wears a hood for her belated debut and may be best watched
runners.name: Molly Marine
runners.spotlight: 3,000gns foal; fourth foal; sister to Italian 6f 2yo/7f winner Be The Winner, half-sister to winners King Of Fury (7f/1m AW; RPR 86) and Lucky Banner (Hong Kong 6f AW; 71); dam placed at 5f-7.5f (75); this 4yo wears a hood for her belated debut and may be best watched.

runners.comment: Likely to be a lot better than she showed on debut but dramatic improvement is necessary
runners.name: Dance Fantasy
runners.spotlight: 62,000gns yearling who should prove to be a lot better than she showed when 12th of 14 at 10-1 on last month's debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta); however, dramatic improvement is necessary if she's to threaten today.

runners.breeder: Mr & Mrs Cotton / Mrs Suzanne Conway
runners.comment: Connections have done well with her family; could take sizeable step forward on second run
runners.name: Feisty Minx
runners.owner: Mrs F Cotton Mr & Mrs P Conway
runners.spotlight: 100-1 and merely mid-division on last month's debut over C&D; however, her trainer isn't known for first-time-out 2yo winners and this 3yo is from a family connections have done well with; could take a sizeable step forward.

runners.comment: 250-1 runner-up over 1m here a fortnight ago; one to consider now back down to 7f
runners.name: Flyta
runners.spotlight: Improved considerably upon November's two 2yo runs when 250-1 runner-up in first-time tongue-tie (retained) over 1m here a fortnight ago (led); shaped as though the drop back to 7f could suit and she's one to consider.

runners.breeder: Whitsbury Manor Stud And Mrs M E Slade
runners.comment: Produced a better effort on second start but needs further improvement; cheekpieces go on
runners.name: Thats Enough
runners.owner: Commercium II And Whitsbury Manor Stud
runners.spotlight: There's potential in her pedigree and she produced a better effort on her second start when fifth of six at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month; however, further improvement is needed today in first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Dam's side of her pedigree indicates she may not come into her own until upped in trip
runners.name: La Kosmos
runners.spotlight: Trainer has enjoyed lots of success with her family and she showed ability when 4l fourth of ten at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) on New Year's Eve on her second start; however, the dam's side of her pedigree indicates she may not come into her own until upped in trip.

runners.comment: Tailed off at 14-1 on debut at Southwell three weeks ago; transformation needed
runners.name: Seapearl
runners.spotlight: Dam was a 6.6f 2yo winner (RPR 75) but this 3yo was tailed off at 14-1 on debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; transformation needed.

runners.comment: Work to do with Seeing Stars but might have each-way shout if breaking on terms this time
runners.name: Blue Celestial
runners.spotlight: 7.5l behind runner-up Seeing Stars when 10l third on stable debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; however, she was slowly away on that second start and might have an each-way shout if breaking on terms.

runners.comment: Not much went right on debut but she caught the eye; could take a big step forward
runners.name: Coul Britannia
runners.spotlight: Slowly away, failed to settle and ran green before catching the eye keeping on into fifth of nine, beaten about 8l, on debut at Wolverhampton last Monday (6f, Tapeta; 25-1); if she's learned from that experience she could take a big step forward now upped to 7f; interesting.

runners.comment: Always behind at 150-1 on last month's debut at Wolverhampton; others make greater appeal
runners.name: Dora Vita
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to four winners; could be sharper on this second start but this 9,000gns yearling was always behind at 150-1 on last month's debut at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) and others make greater appeal.

runners.comment: Made it 0-4 when unplaced favourite last time, but twice runner-up; could be in the mix
runners.name: Galileo Charm
runners.spotlight: Made it 0-4 when unplaced favourite at Wolverhampton (7f, Tapeta) last month; twice runner-up, however, including over C&D and in these reapplied cheekpieces (which replace blinkers), and she could be in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-3 but runner-up on all three starts and holds leading form claims
runners.name: Seeing Stars
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on all three starts (7f, Tapeta), most recently at Southwell three weeks ago when clear of the remainder; leading form claims.

runners.comment: Went close at Wolverhampton on debut last month and could have a significant part to play
runners.name: Show Me Gold
runners.spotlight: Belied market weakness when going close in six-runner novice at Wolverhampton on last month's debut (7f, Tapeta; 9-1); open to improvement and she could have a significant part to play on this second start.

20:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Clear pb when off the mark last time (7f, Polytrack); enters h'caps open to progress
runners.name: Savannah Grey
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who was too green to justify favouritism here (6f) on her debut in 2024; much better when off the mark in four-runner Chelmsford novice (7f, Polytrack) two months ago and now enters handicaps open to plenty of progress; tongue-tie goes on; player.

runners.comment: Running with credit of late; little wiggle room in her mark but can give a good account
runners.name: Lady Wingalong
runners.spotlight: 4-20 on AW (wins include Polytrack) and she's been running with plenty of credit since December; little wiggle room in this mark but she's likely to give another good account.

runners.comment: 2nd all 3 starts; return to 7f a help on h'cap debut; market helpful after 225-day break
runners.name: Bee My Honey
runners.owner: The Hot Shots Syndicate & Ms C Musgrave
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who has been runner-up all three starts; raced freely when a beaten favourite on her comeback over C&D in May and turned over at odds-on when dropped back down to 6f (Tapeta) the following month; not seen subsequently but it's still early days and the return to 7f should help; market helpful on this handicap debut after a 225-day absence.

runners.comment: Has run well here; went close in 10f h'cap (Polytrack; cheekpieces) in October; yard debut
runners.name: Summer Heat
runners.spotlight: Promising fourth of 14 on her debut (C&D) in May and went close in 1m2f Chelmsford handicap (Polytrack; cheekpieces) in October; fraction off that when fourth back there (1m, first-time visor) three weeks later and subsequently left Saeed bin Suroor for 55,000gns; new owners will be keen to get a win into her and she's respected on this stable debut.

runners.comment: Back to form with C&D third (first-time eyeshield) last week; respected off same mark
runners.name: Exposay
runners.spotlight: Won a Thirsk maiden (7f, good to soft) in July; hasn't repeated that form but a close third over C&D (first-time eyeshield) last week was her best effort since; not discounted off the same mark under promising Harry Vigors.

runners.comment: Won track novice (6f) in 2023 but no wins since despite declining mark; down the list
runners.name: Holy Fire
runners.spotlight: Won track novice (6f) in May 2023; hasn't scored since despite a declining mark and she needs to bounce back from a poor run last time; down the list.

20:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap (London Middle Distance Qualifier) (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Ready win at Newcastle last time, taking AW record to 10-26; he's 3-5 at Kempton
runners.name: Kings Code
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper who registered a ready win on trials day at Newcastle (1m2f) most recently, looking better than ever and taking AW strike-rate to 10-26; record of 3-5 at Kempton features a success in the final of this series last year; respected, even though he's on a career-high mark.

runners.comment: Won this race off just 1lb lower last year; good second on Boxing Day; very solid claims
runners.name: Paradias
runners.spotlight: Building up a consistent AW record that features a narrow success in this race (off just 1lb lower) last year and creditable effort at Newcastle on finals day; ran well, going down by only a neck, at Wolverhampton on Boxing Day when back from a layoff; very solid claims.

runners.comment: Cesarewitch winner; eyecatching third to King's Code at Newcastle on reappearance
runners.name: Beylerbeyi
runners.spotlight: Couple of notable performances since wearing a hood, namely a success in the Cesarewitch (2m2f) and eyecatching third to King's Code at Newcastle dropped back a mile in trip; by no means just a stayer, he enters calculations in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Useful turf performer on his day for Roger Varian; AW/stable debut
runners.name: Shadow Dance
runners.spotlight: Campaigned on turf for Roger Varian, often in notable handicaps (won one at York in 2024); failed to reproduce his peak figures in a light 2025 campaign and sold for 60,000gns since last run; the betting may prove best guide on AW/stable debut.

runners.comment: About 2l behind Paradias in this race last year and at Wolverhampton latest start
runners.name: Haku
runners.spotlight: Multiple AW winner who should give his running but may struggle to defy current mark (career-high one) and reverse placings with Paradias; finished about 2l behind that rival in this contest 12 months ago and at Wolverhampton latest start.

runners.comment: Has failed to beat a rival in two runs since racing in Britain and switched to AW
runners.name: Bravais
runners.spotlight: Capable of very useful form on turf in France then Ireland; however, has failed to beat a rival in two starts (1m) since racing in Britain and switched to AW; best watched unless the market suggests a revival is likely.

runners.comment: Below par when last seen; progressive otherwise on AW; likely player if back on song
runners.name: The Glen Rovers
runners.spotlight: Absent since below-par effort in November when bidding for a second success in the final of this series; progressive otherwise on AW and still has a noteworthy strike-rate (5-9) in this sphere; close fourth when favourite for this race last year; likely player if back on song.

runners.comment: Failed to transfer the form of Shergar Cup win back to AW on reappearance
runners.name: Night Breeze
runners.spotlight: Ended his 2025 campaign with a win on Shergar Cup day at Ascot but failed to transfer that form back to AW on reappearance, finishing last in the Newcastle event won by King's Code; something to prove off current mark kept to this sphere.

runners.comment: Record of 5-10 at Kempton, all over 1m; trip query aside, he's attractively weighted
runners.name: Whitcombe Rockstar
runners.spotlight: Somewhat interesting off an attractive mark back at Kempton, being 5-10 here, but all of that course form is over 1m; has a mixed record beyond that distance so carries risk back up in trip; however, certainly holds a fighting chance provided he's in top form.

runners.comment: Won off 2lb higher at Kempton in 2024; possibilities if taking well to headgear
runners.name: Assail
runners.spotlight: Creditable second at Southwell (1m4f) in September but has failed to repeat the form in two outings over the same C&D since; defied a 2lb higher mark at Kempton in 2024 and receives weight all round in this field, so has possibilities if taking well to first-time headgear.
